name: GST Registration
shortDescription: Goods and Services Tax is an indirect tax used in India on the supply of goods and service.
description: Goods and Services Tax is an indirect tax used in India on the supply of goods and service. It is an Indirect tax which introduced to replace other Indirect taxes such as value added tax, service tax, purchase tax, excise duty. On July 1st 2017, the Goods and Services Tax was implemented in India. Any company that is eligible under GST must register itself in the GST portal created by the Government of India.

content.title: Minimal Compliance
content.description: Under the GST Composition scheme the taxpayer is required to furnish quarterly return only. Thus this reduces the number of compliance requirements and ensures smooth operation of business.

content.title: Legal Recognition
content.description: The GST Registration provides the entity legal recognition as supplier of goods and services. Legally authorizes the registered entity to collect tax from purchasers.

content.title: Easy Procedure
content.description: There is a simplified and automated procedure for various processes such as registration, returns, refunds and tax payments. GST prevents cascading of taxes by providing a comprehensive input tax credit mechanism across the entire supply chain.

faqs.question: Is it necessary for all entities to register under the GST?
faqs.answer: All businesses and traders who earn turnovers in excess of Rs.20 lakh have to register under the GST Law.

faqs.question: What is meant by composition levy?
faqs.answer: The composition levy is an alternative method of levy of tax designed for small taxpayers whose turnover is up to Rs. 75 lakhs (Rs. 50 lakhs in case of few States). The objective of composition scheme is to bring simplicity and to reduce the compliance cost for the small taxpayers.

faqs.question: What is the validity of composition levy?
faqs.answer: The option to pay tax under composition levy would remain valid so long as conditions mentioned in section 10 of the CGST Act, 2017

faqs.question: If I have questions regarding my documents or the process, how can I ask?
faqs.answer: Once you purchase any product from the ezyLegal website, you will be credited minutes in your account. You can use these minutes to connect with the Lawyer and ask questions and take guidance from the Expert.

faqs.question: How to register GST in India?
faqs.answer: ezyLegal can help you get your GST registered and provide you with the right legal guidance. You can schedule your Consultation with an ezyLegal Lawyer and know the detailed process and advantages of registering GST

faqs.question: How will I know the status of the registration process?
faqs.answer: Status updates will be available on the ezyLegal website (www.ezylegal.in) in your secured Account. Additionally, you will be notified on email and WhatsApp.
